cnbc.title: Apple sees big December quarter driven by strong iPhone 17 demand
cnbc.summary: The fourth quarter, which runs through the end of September, is the first quarter that includes sales from new iPhone 17 models.

cnbc.title: Amazon raises spending forecast to $125 billion as third-quarter results top estimates
cnbc.summary: AWS revenue accelerated 20.2% to $33 billion, which CEO Andy Jassy said was a pace it hadn't seen since 2022.

cnbc.title: Netflix announces a 10-for-1 stock split
cnbc.summary: The stock is currently one of 10 stocks in the S&P 500 with a price above $1,000.

cnbc.title: Amazon cloud records 20% sales growth, topping estimates
cnbc.summary: Amazon Web Services is the world's top provider of cloud infrastructure, but it's facing intensifying pressure from competitors Google and Microsoft.

cnbc.title: Palantir communications chief calls the company's political shift 'concerning'
cnbc.summary: Palantir Head of Global Communications Lisa Gordon's comments come as CEO Alex Karp aligns himself further with the Trump administration.

cnbc.title: Coinbase earnings top estimates, helped by robust trading volume
cnbc.summary: Coinbase shares rose more than 2% after the crypto exchange posted better-than-expected earnings and revenue for the third quarter.

cnbc.title: Reddit shares rise on earnings beat, strong forecast
cnbc.summary: Reddit reported third-quarter earnings on Thursday in which the company beat on the top and bottom and provided strong guidance.

cnbc.title: SF Mayor Lurie says city 'on the rise' after Trump reverses course on troop deployment
cnbc.summary: Mayor Lurie told CNBC that he feels pressure "every day" to deliver safe and clean streets for residents.

cnbc.title: Chipotle stock craters as Wall Street grows concerned after company cuts forecast
cnbc.summary: At least five Wall Street analysts have cut their price targets for Chipotle shares after the chain's third-quarter earnings report.

cnbc.title: How the Fed's decision to lower interest rates could widen the generational wealth gap
cnbc.summary: Lowering the federal funds rate typically leads to increases in asset values and may widen wealth gaps in the U.S.
